reviews.text: It's a beautiful structure that remind of the past history .Nice to snap a few pictures...or u can do some shopping nearby
Nice for a short walk around, entree fee is 34 yen
Did not walk in as there is an entrance fee and the place did not look interesting enough to make us part with the entrance fee.
I prefer come during winter, because Russian feels
Not worth it, you can save your money and skip
Wonderful calm place among the city bustle. Open every day but Wednesday. Entrance free but ID needed.
Чудесный этнографический музейный комплекс, как все иные в Харбине подобные заведения совершенно бесплатный.
風景很好
就在军区旁，没什么人气。

It was a pretty unique experience. We bought some pieces of meat, using cash with the bus driver, and it brought the tigers right up to us! Good for about 3 hours of fun. If you only speak English, be ready to go with a translation app. The ATM did not accept our card so it is good to have cash before you arrive. No lines if you go when they open!

Not here to start a debate on the morals and ethics on this tiger park. Visited as part of a tour, and this is like a mini safari, where you will sit in a bus, and move from locked compounds. There were quite a number of tigers that were free to roam within the "specific" gated areas. However, we noticed a large number were also kept confined in very tiny cages at the edges of the said gated areas. If you will get distressed by caged animals, perhaps it would not be wise to visit here. 

Tourist can purchase a selection of meat, including whole chickens, and engage in feeding of the tigers. Being top of the food chain, it is expected that the tigers will consume meat, but again, if it poses any distress, better to skip this place. 

All in, it was not a bad day, apart from the sight of many tigers in the tiny cages.
This place was amazing. The tigers are so beautiful yet so terrifying. You dont realize the size and strength of one until you get close. I recommend going any day
A must place to visit to see tiger up close. Feed the tigers to see how they eat. Definitely for family

The tigers are kept in relatively good condition and they all look healthy and comfortable. However, there are times when the buses would bump into the tigers on purpose to get them to stay away. There is also live-feeding of chickens, which I understand is necessary and a part of nature but is still difficult to look at.
beautifull place for walk in winter in the heart from Haerbin
Looks beautiful, but currently closed.
In winter time the Zhaolin Park hosts an ice sculpture exhibition not as big as the international one across the river but very nice to look at and costs only half of it. Definitely worth a visit.
No bad
FIne place
Free of charge, you need only your identity card or passport to get a ticket. Enjoy the history of HeiLongJiang.
Rich Russian and Chinese culture fusion
Not a bad place to be in . Interesting. A pity that there was not much Eng explanation
Interesting museum to learn about Harbin and its past
เดินเพลิดเพลินมากๆคับ แบ่งการเช่าชมเป็นโซนๆ เข้าใจง่าย เดินสบายมีที่นั่งเป็นชุดๆ มั่งคนนำเที่ยวน่ารัก😊😊

Visited in the dead of winter, as was pleasantly surprised to see that the river was actually transformed into some sort of winter wonderland type of attraction. Didn't come with much knowledge or expectations, was assuming it will be a huge river frozen over, but I saw an ice maze, ice sculptures which you lose count of, ice skating, some form of ice sledding etc. 

I think it is quite a popular place, given there were quite a bit of people enjoying the various ice-related activities. Coming from the southern hemisphere, this truly was a sight to behold, and I had a decent time experiencing the kid of cold that I had never encountered before. Overall, its worthwhile to visit, just take note facilities such as washrooms can get way too many tourists, so queues are scary long.
In winter season at SongHua river. Everything covered with snow. There's an attraction where some people swimming in this river that called "Winter Swimming"
Excellent place to visit in China
The Songhua River is one of the primary rivers of China, and the largest tributary of the Amur River.
銘記大師葉銘村剖出松花江景，跨江鐵橋樑，人文街道，值得推薦給大家參考旅遊的地方。
beautifull place for walk in winter in the heart from Haerbin
Looks beautiful, but currently closed.
In winter time the Zhaolin Park hosts an ice sculpture exhibition not as big as the international one across the river but very nice to look at and costs only half of it. Definitely worth a visit.
No bad
FIne place

韭菜鲅鱼的煎饺，等了好久最后上来的，也是中规中矩的
本来点到这觉得足够了，服务员非说不够吃，于是又加了一个小炒香菇，就是辣味，别的真没什么不一样，后来基本上没吃两口，茄子也剩了好多，最后只好打包，真不应该听服务员的点这么多

Template Shangri La: room clean, quiet and a tad old fashioned. However, avoid ordering "cocktails" at all cost from the lounge. Better off drinking water. They need to have a cocktail bartender who would use fresh juice and actual alcohol. Not fair to get the waitresses to make them. It is an art not to be abused. Undrinkable.

A 5-star hotel that has had its heyday. While staff are generally attentive, the rooms are dated and tired-looking. If you have access to the lounge, the view is pretty amazing in winter which is when most go to Harbin! Take a leisurely walk on the river towards the city centre when it's frozen.

Nice property with a great location in Harbin by the Songhua River. Rooms are a bit tired, but everything is functional and clean. English communication is a bit shaky. Bellmen were very helpful in obtaining taxis and local information. Lounge bar is nice, albeit with a limited cocktail menu.

This is not so much a review of the hotel, but a dining venue within the premises, referred to as 冰宫餐厅. Basically, a hot pot restaurant set within an ice room. It will be easier to imagine eating hot pot in a giant walk in freezer. 

As it is Shangri-la, the prices are not what I would regard as cheap. Service is ok, as we were a rather sizable group, the staff had a hard time keeping up with orders and refills. The biggest flaw of the meal, is that, whoever who came up with the concept, failed to account for very large groups simultaneously eating hot pot. Early into the meal, as heat built up, the ice inside started melting at an alarming rate. Instead of experiencing dining in an igloo, it was more like dining in the middle of a tropical rain storm. To make matters worse, whenever the water drips into the pots, the hot soup splashes out. We were all completely drenched  from the barrage of relentless melting ice and splashing hot soup, by the end of the meal, and did not enjoy it very much. Perhaps it will be better, with a much much much smaller number of pax.

Sales Manager Peter Zhang went out of his way to accommodate us and make our experience at staying at Shangri-La outstanding and very pleasant. 

Peter is one amazing person, full of positive energy, and is always helping in nature. 

When Peter has to go after his work he asked Elton to make sure that our evening scheduled taxi tour is being arranged. Elton was also very supportive and helpful.

Keep up this excellent people working for Shangri-La.

One of the best Pizza Huts in the area. First folks in so the buffet wasn’t completely out yet. Though the food that was, was absolutely delicious & hot. Staff was friendly & on top of things. Restaurant was pretty clean & well organized.
SO so ummy...and I love supporting young readers -- thanks, Hut! ...did I mention how very yummy the pizza was? Seriously. Good pizza 🥰
Love their pizza! It's the best anywhere. The service at this one is amazing, too!
Food was good and so was the service. Waitress was great also!
Pizza hut has been always the best pizza and love the salads and sauces. Great services as well.

Excellent Russian food, great place, nice and good service
Great atmosphere. Pretty much all that's good about this place. Food was ok.

After whole day professional photo shooting, my boyfriend, and my parents have already super hungry. We went to try Russian Food nearby. The restaurant named PORTMAN WESTERN RESTAURANT, which located on Zhangyang St. Harbin. It was very famous Russian Restaurant in my hometown. When I was Child, my family was used to go here to have a dinner. At that time, the food here was great. My family and I went to Portman with high expectations this time, but it turned out that it became one of the worst dining experiences we’ ve ever had,  from the service to the food. The waiters were unfriendly and slow.They all seemed to hate this job so much. When we asked questions about the menu, neither of them gave us what we want to know. We ordered the desserts for, after the dinner, they brought up them before the dinner. We asked them to keep the desserts in the back, and we would eat after the dinner. The server was totally ignored us. Food came very slow and not fresh. My favorite dish Russian Red Soup was not even hot. I had a worse experience with this restaurant.
环境还可以 内部装修有自己的风格  食物推荐他们的自酿红酒 很好喝
挺好吃的，如果肚子饿是个不错的选择

Love walking into a Starbucks and smelling the fresh coffee. This location was clean and the staff friendly. Coffee was made to order and correctly made for this picky coffee drinker lol. This spot has an area for when you are wanting to socialize or break out the computer/books and do some studying while sipping on a latte. Only problem I seen was the drive through and parking area are very tight but couldn't take a star away just for that. Keep it up at this location cause my little girl and I will definitely be back for our coffee.
Always fast, friendly, and informative! Their coffee is great and their snacks are always yummy! Mobile pickup through their app is always very convenient as well!

Yummy but prices need to stop going up, they  are beyond being a very successful business that has millions of people addicted and stopping for ine of their many yummy beverages and foods almost every day like its crack, stop being greedy with the cost increase of everything, PLEASE. I want to be able to afford my coffee "crack" lol just playing, kinda. Attention there's no illegal drugs served at any Starbucks facility
... that I'm aware of!
Very friendly service. Got the order correct. Fast.
Rude, impersonal staff, slow service, dirty restrooms. The food is blah, you get better quality food at much lower prices at McDonalds or any of the other fast food chains in the area.
